Are you in love with me?, I ask my dear cousin as he helps me out of the car.I do find it rather intrigingintriguing as to why he was so persistant to me coming to tea by myself.As he starts up a conversation about my chauffeur, he leads me into his house.
I had never been to his house before, and yet I have to admit it is quite charming.Compared to mine and Tom's home it is miniscule, yet something about it makes one feel at home.Nick leads me straight into the first room, the living, yet he looks confused, surprised even, yet I can notcannot understand what his reasoning for this would be.Suddenly there's a knocking on the door.Nick rushes to the front door in order to let that person in.I decide to take a look around the room.There is a stiff chair as well as a fireplace, on top of which there are a few flowers.I turn my attention to the big clock hanging from the wall as I notice a presence.Expecting Nick I turn to face him rather quickly, yet as soon as my eyes land on the person under the door frame all air seems to have vanished.
Jay Gatsby.He moves further into the room as we both struggle to find any words.With a choking sound in his voice he greets me and I can't help but let out a laugh.An uncomfortable laugh.What is he doing here?This can't be happening.I'm married now.I have Tom.And yet I can't deny that I am awfully glad to see him.And so I say it, before our stuttering turns into silence.
I decide to take a seat on the stiff chair as I attempt to calm down.It is in this moment, when Nick walks through the door and I feel awfully relivedrelieved.Suddenly the clock hanging on the fall falls dangerously at the pressure of Jay's head and yet I can't even smile because of his clumsiness.I'm paralized.I haven't seen Jay in years and he comes back into my life now?I am not only married, but I also have a daughter.A part from that I already made my decision years ago, when I decided to forget about that letter and marry Tom instead.I can't go back now.I mention how long it has been since we last saw each other.Five years next November.And for some reason my heart swells.He has been counting.Counting how long it has been since we last were in eachotherseach other's presence.Nick decides to leave the room and Jay follows right behind him.I have so many thoughts going through my head, that I just sit still.I sit in this little room, in this little stiff chair and think about what has just occured.
Suddenly Jay comes into the room.Alone.He sits down in front of me and after a lot of trembling and stuttering he masters to say a few words.He tells me exactly what I had been hoping to hear from him before meeting Tom.How he had prepared all of those parties in the hopes that I would go and for some reason the thought of having had him so very close all of this time makes me well up, as I too confess my feelings to him.With me weeping and Jay smiling Nick walks back into the living room.He explains to Jay how it has stopped raining and Jay reacts in a most excited and happy way, that ends up making me just as happy.Jay invites us to take a look at his house and I happily oblige, as I don't believe I have been this full of joy in years.
